The correct answer is B. AWS Trusted Advisor.
AWS Trusted Advisor is a service that provides guidance to help users provision resources following AWS best practices. It can also help users optimize resources for better cost-efficiency and security by providing real-time alerts and notifications. One of the checks that Trusted Advisor can perform is for the IAM access keys that have not been rotated recently.

Option A, AWS WAF, is a web application firewall service that helps protect web applications from common web exploits.
Option C, Amazon Inspector, is an automated security assessment service that helps improve the security and compliance of applications deployed on AWS.
Option D, AWS Certificate Manager (ACM), is a service that provides SSL/TLS certificates that can be used to secure network communications.

questions.question_text: Which AWS service should a company use to check for IAM access keys that have not been rotated recently?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. Amazon Trust Advisor
 
Security Groups - Specific Ports Unrestricted (Free!)
Checks security groups for rules that allow unrestricted access (0.0.0.0/0) to specific ports. Unrestricted access increases opportunities for malicious activity (hacking, denial-of-service attacks, loss of data). The ports with highest risk are flagged red, and those with less risk are flagged yellow. Ports flagged green are typically used by applications that require unrestricted access, such as HTTP and SMTP.
 
Ref link: https://www.amazonaws.cn/en/support/trustedadvisor/best-practices/

Selected Answer: D
D is the answer.

Selected Answer: A
A. The deletion of IAM users requires the use of AWS account root user credentials.
Explanation: IAM users are created by an AWS account root user or an IAM user with administrator permissions. IAM users cannot delete other IAM users, only the AWS account root user can do so. Therefore, to delete an IAM user, the user needs to log in with AWS account root user credentials.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Users can exchange Convertible RIs for other Convertible RIs from a different instance family
 
Convertible Reserved Instances -Convertible RIs give you even more flexibility and offer a significant discount (typically 45% compared to On-Demand). They allow you to change the instance family and other parameters associated with a Reserved Instance at any time.
 
https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/aws/ec2-reserved-instance-update-convertible-ris-and-regional-benefit/#:~:text=Convertible%20Reserved%20Instances%20%2DConvertible%20RIs,Reserved%20Instance%20at%20any%20time.

Selected Answer: A
A. Users can exchange Convertible RIs for other Convertible RIs from a different instance family
"You can exchange one or more Convertible Reserved Instances for another Convertible Reserved Instance with a different configuration, including instance family, operating system, and tenancy. There are no limits to how many times you perform an exchange, as long as the new Convertible Reserved Instance is of an equal or higher value than the Convertible Reserved Instances that you are exchanging."

https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/ri-convertible-exchange.html

Selected Answer: A
A. Users can exchange Convertible RIs for other Convertible RIs from a different instance family

Selected Answer: D
The correct answer is:
D. Users can shorten the term of their Convertible RIs by merging them with other Convertible RIs
Explanation: Convertible Reserved Instances (RIs) are a type of AWS pricing option that allows users to change the attributes of the RI during its term. This means that users can exchange Convertible RIs for other Convertible RIs with different attributes, such as instance type or operating system, but they cannot exchange them for other Convertible RIs from a different instance family or AWS Region. Additionally, Convertible RIs cannot be sold or bought on the AWS Marketplace. One of the key benefits of Convertible RIs is the ability to shorten the term of the RI by merging it with other Convertible RIs. This can be useful if a user needs to reduce their RI commitment or switch to a different pricing option.

Selected Answer: A
A is the answer.

questions.question_text: What is a characteristic of Convertible Reserved Instances (RIs)?

choices.D: Users can shorten the term of their Convertible RIs by merging them with other Convertible RIs
choices.B: Users can exchange Convertible RIs for other Convertible RIs in different AWS Regions
choices.C: Users can sell and buy Convertible RIs on the AWS Marketplace
choices.A: Users can exchange Convertible RIs for other Convertible RIs from a different instance family
